data.title: added "suspend_rollback()" functionality
data.body:
Allows checkpoint saving to be suspended, which means rolling back will skip over the current code to prior to the suspension.  Useful for minigames, where you'd rather people not be able to back up into different states, but you don't want to block rollback entirely.

Example code:

```
label start:

    scene black
    "test of rollback skipping"

    "should rollback to here"

    $ renpy.suspend_rollback(True)

    "you won't see this line in rollback"

    "or this one"

    $ renpy.suspend_rollback(False)

    "roll back now"

    return
```

data.title: Clean Environment on Ren'Py Restart
data.body: Especially, remove SDL_VIDEODRIVER if it's windib.

data.title: HW Video Playback isn't paused on device sleep.
Ren'Py should save to the "Saved Games" directory on Vista and newer.
data.body:
Since Windows Vista there has been a "Saved Games" directory (which defaults to `~/Saved Games`). It would be nice if Ren'Py could use this directory for saving its game data as the `%APPDATA%` folder which Ren'Py currently uses is not something which is normally visible to users which makes it hard for backing up saves when migrating between systems.

Reference: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dd378457.aspx#FOLDERID_SavedGames

data.title: Enhanced custom text tags.
data.body: The idea would be to look for text tags (probably beginning with a sigil). When we find one, we find the matching closing tag. We then pass the list of tokens between opening and closing to a function that returns a new list of tokens, which are parsed instead of the original list of tokens.

data.title: Music loop lag
data.body:
I'm not sure if it's my computer fault or the new version of Renpy, but the music doesn't loop smoothly anymore in my game. This was not a problem before. Now there is a small latency before the music starts again. It's really small but audible. I use the loop fonction to loop very small music files (such as drum loops), so I clearly hear it and it ruins the rythmic loops. 

I have verified that my files are real loops, and they are. They loop perfectly in Audacity, for exemple. So the latency comes from Renpy. The problem didn't exist in previous versions of Renpy. Any ideas ?

Sorry for my bad english, I'm french.

data.title: Ren'Py doc doesn't explain "nvl show" & "nvl hide"
data.body: Now, renpy doc doesn't explain "nvl show" & "nvl hide" statement.

data.title: keyboard_focus True error
data.body:
I'm running Arch Linux and was hoping to play around with Ren'Py. There's [a package for it in the Arch User Repository](https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/renpy-aio/) that seems to have the latest version. However, I can't get the editor to fire up. Behold:

```
● ~ ❱ renpy --version
Ren'Py 6.18.3.761
● ~ ❱ renpy

File "renpy/common/_errorhandling.rpym", line 99: style property keyboard_focus is not known.
    keyboard_focus True
                  ^
START /usr/bin/gvim -f "errors.txt"
● ~ 255❱ 
```

That `255` at the end is the exit code. I went trolling around in the source as installed on my machine and found several references to `keyboard_focus`. They looked to be the same as what's on Github and the release notes mention that this was added in 6.18.2. I'm not sure what else to check to see why it won't work on my machine.

Any advice?

data.title: Why action Return(None) returns True?
data.body:
Tried:

```
label start:
    call screen testing
    $ a = _return
    "[_return] [a]"
    return

screen testing():
    textbutton "Press HERE" action Return(None) align (.5,.5)
```

Got "True" in "_return"

data.title: Unhovered event not being called
data.body:
We have a map screen that shows different options when you hover over a location. These options appear in a modal to keep from conflicting with the map background, and we use a mousearea with a focus mask to tell when the user moves their mouse outside of the location. When they do, we hide the options so they can hover over other locations.

This works perfectly when mouse movement is slow, however when mouse movement is quick, the unhovered event is often not called, forcing the options menu to remain open until the user re-enters and re-exits the mousearea.

A commit where this problem can be viewed is here: https://github.com/Dischan/Dysfunctional-Systems-Ep2/tree/map_debug. To test, just start the game, go to New Story, test, and Show Map. There's no real way to reliably reproduce the bug, however if you move your mouse around the map rapidly you should notice it. It might be easier to trigger if the resolution is set to 576p.

The relevant code is located in game/ui_script/map/map_ui.rpy. Please let me know if you need any explanation of the code.

Thank you for your time.

data.title: variable "_return" in doc
data.body:
The use of "_return" is documented in http://renpy.org/doc/html/screens.html#call-screen, but maybe it would be useful to add this information in the "input" section: http://renpy.org/doc/html/screens.html#input
It's a question that newbies usually do. What do you think?

(e.g.: http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=8&t=29434)

data.title: Lint doesn't find a tag in hide X when "show expression as X" was used in a called label
data.body:
This code:

```
image eileen happy = "eileen_happy.png"
image another_eileen happy = "eileen_happy.png"

label start:

    # Test 1
    show eileen happy at right
    pause
    hide eileen

    # Test 2
    show expression "eileen_happy.png" at left as an_image
    pause
    hide an_image

    # Test 3
    call show_another_image
    pause
    hide another_image

    # Test 4
    call show_another_eileen
    pause
    hide another_eileen

    pause
    return

label show_another_image:
    show expression "eileen_happy.png" at right as another_image
    return

label show_another_eileen:
    show another_eileen happy at left
    return
```

Produces a wrong Lint message in the Test # 3:
game/script.rpy:19 The image tag 'another_image' is not the prefix of a declared image, nor was it used in a show statement before this hide statement.

parsing of class attribute in index of variable in displayed string
data.body:
```
init python:
    class test_class:
        pass

label start:
    python:
        t = test_class()
        t.t = 0
        n = ['success']

    "[n[t.t]]"
```

data.title: string interpolation with dictionaries and class members
data.body:
I am not sure if the function is intended to be supported, but I would like to be able to use a class member as a dictionary index inside of a say statement. I tried a few ways, but none of them work, and the most puzzling result is the double-bracketed one, which appears to drop an end-bracket in its interpretation. This is a complete script file that shows the problem I am having:

```
init python:
    class key_class:
        def __init__(self):
            self.string = "one"

    d = {"one":"the first item"}
    c = key_class()

label start:
    #"the first item is [d[one]]" #the first item is the first item
    #"the first item is [d['one']]" #KeyError: u"'one'"
    #"the first item is [d[c.string]]" #KeyError: u'c.string'
    "the first item is [d[[c.string]]]" #KeyError: u'[c.string'

    return
```

Is it possible to do this, or is the ideal method to set temporary variables?

data.title: Let choose to developer if strings need to be empty while generating translations
data.body:
I created a specific option in the preference panel to handle this behavior and I subordinated it to the rot13 check.

I think it will be useful to change that check also and to create explicit request to the developer for rot13 option, maybe with just before the export and after the choose of the language name, so it will not be tied to the language name.

data.title: method of suspending logging to make rollback skip
data.body:
Used to make rollback skip over renpy-coded minigames where rolling back _into_ the game would cause cheating or other issues.

$ renpy.rollback_suspend(True)
 renpy code
more renpy code
$ renpy.rollback_suspend(False)

data.title: Screens should take default layer to show on.
data.body:
```
screen foo:
     layer "new_layer"

     text "Hello, world."
```

data.title: Main Menu Video Background
data.body:
I added a video to my main screen as a background, but when using "X" to exit, the menu will disappear. Clicking "X" again will exit ren'py. I have found that if you don't double click, but click "X" once and then right click, you can make the menu reappear.

I found out how to put in the video using this thread, where the issue was mentioned.
http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=8&t=23365

data.title: project now requires "label start:"
data.body: There's been a change in the engine's behavior, where a "label start:" is required in the code, even if this label is never called or jumped to.  Omitting the label results in a traceback.  While most projects will use the standard start label, this change in behavior might break some games.

data.title: Python statement at end of file is not followed by return.
data.body:

```
    $ renpy.call_screen("deeble_results")
```

data.title: \ should quote [
data.body: Similar to how \% is equivalent to %%.

data.title: from __future__ import unicode_strings
data.body: This should probably be the default in a near-future version of Ren'Py, to ease the py3 transition.
